p: Overall, 93/123 (76%; 95% CI: 67–83%) adults retested for HIV 2–3 months following their initial HIV-negative test. Retesting uptake was highest in the standard, gain-framed incentive group (88%) and lowest in high-value contract (72%) and no incentive (71%) groups ( Table 1). Among contract participants who made a deposit, HIV retesting was 78% in low- and 76% in high-value groups. As noted in the Methods, this pilot trial was not powered to detect statistically significant differences in retesting between arms. No seroconversions were observed.
